alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 8:09PM CDT until April 20 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Bowie County in northeastern Texas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Texarkana. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Red Lick, Mandeville, Genoa, Leary and Mount Pleasant. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
